bug.author: lmeyerov
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
When setting --server.baseUrlPath="st/", I'd expect static asset requests to be st/assets/, but requests seem to be for /assets for iconic portions: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4249447/90448247-d9fbd700-e099-11ea-8f53-3fdca687105e.png></denchmark-link>
There seems to be some back-and-forth repeat regressions on this, e.g, <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/1725>#1725</denchmark-link>
Within the page, there does not seem to be any base path tag in the <head>, making this more fun The iconic resources do appear to be getting served on localhost:8501/st/assets/..., but in-browser requests are to localhost:8501/assets. We're also struggling with the workaround of redirecting /assets -> /st/assets at the reverse proxy layer, but unclear if that's on our side or something in server strictness settings. We have enableCORS = false but otherwise vanilla, and current bet is our proxy. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
What are the steps we should take to reproduce the bug: Run with --server.baseUrlPath="st/" <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
Default page loads <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
See above -- many assets load, but Iconic related seem to fail <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
We've been trying to get this to work, so unclear <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: latest stable - 0.62.2 Python version: 3.7 Using Conda? pip installed OS version: ubuntu 18.04 (docker) Browser version: chrome
<denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
We're trying to prove out streamlit for enterprise dashboarding, so doing a standard-ish customer-controlled auth bastion + URL -> reverse proxy -> streamlit dockers for a subpath

comments.comment: Ah, closing -- this seems to have been some silent failures leading to running an older version than what our config specified, apologies!
Glad you got it figured out <denchmark-link:https://github.com/lmeyerov>@lmeyerov</denchmark-link> , let us know if you have any other issues.
